alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Itasca, Aitkin, northeastern Cass, northeastern Pine, southern St. Louis, Carlton and northwestern Douglas Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1129 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coleraine, to near Jacobson, to 9 miles north of Malmo, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Swan River, Warba and Jacobson around 1135 AM CDT. Mille Lacs Band East Lake Area around 1140 AM CDT. Pengilly around 1145 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Keewatin, Nashwauk, Toivola, Meadowlands, Kettle River, Moose Lake, Cherry, Barnum, Mahtowa, Cotton, Nemadji and Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for north central, northeastern and east central Minnesota.
